ARABIC: فَٱخْتَلَفَ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ مِنۢ بَيْنِهِمْ فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن مَّشْهَدِ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The parties differed among themselves. Woe to those who are kafir when they are present on a terrible Day!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet the sectarians differed among themselves. Alas for the unbelievers when they see the Terrible Day!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: But different parties began to dispute with one another. A dreadful woe awaits on that great Day for those that reject the Truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (The followers of Jesus) turned themselves into quarrelling sects. The disbelievers shall face a woeful condition on the great Day (of Judgment).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then groups among them differed; so ruin is for the disbelievers from the witnessing of a Great Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then the sects differed, so woe unto the disbelievers from the meeting of a great Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: But parties from among them disagreed with each other, so woe to those who disbelieve, because of presence on a great day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But the parties have fallen into variance among themselves; then woe to those who disbelieve for the scene of a dreadful day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The sects among them differ: but woe unto the disbelievers from the meeting of an awful Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Yet different groups differed among themselves. How awful it will be for those who have rejected the truth when a dreadful Day arrives!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then the sects have differed among themselves; so woe to those who disbelieve in the witness of a Day Mighty!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to the faithless at the scene of a tremendous day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But the sects differ among themselves: and woe to the unbelievers because of the (coming) Judgment of a Momentous Day!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then the sects differed [i.e. the Christians about 'Iesa (Jesus)], so woe unto the disbelievers [those who gave false witness by saying that 'Iesa (Jesus) is the son of Allah] from the meeting of a great Day (i.e. the Day of Resurrection, when they will be thrown in the blazing Fire).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But the parties have fallen into variance among themselves, then woe to those who disbelieve for the scene of a Dreadful Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But the various factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who disbelieve from the scene of a tremendous Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:37] But the factions differed among themselves, that is to say, the Christians, [they differed] regarding Jesus: was he the son of God? A god alongside Him? Or [was he] the third of three [gods]? So woe — [meaning] severe punishment [will be meted out] — to those who disbelieve, [those who disbelieve] in the way mentioned and in other ways, at the scene of an awful Day, that is to say, [woe to them] when they are present at the Day of Resurrection and [witnessing] its terrors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The sects) the disbelievers (among them differ) some saying He is Allah, some he is the son of Allah and some Allah's partner: (but woe) a river in Gehenna containing puss and blood; it is also said that this means: severe chastisement (unto the disbelievers) who became different sects regarding Jesus (from the meeting of an awful Day) from the chastisement of the Day of Judgement.
